column5: Got my first carp of the season in my kayak tonight... its amazing how great they fight, especially in strong current  here are some shots
Good stuff man!  (Seems even carp guys are using "the pose" now. LOL! )
Thanks for posting, Jamie. I must say, very photogenic and you too. Nice yak too. When's marlin season open?
Marlin is open right now!!! I am just stuck up here... How you been Roy?
Nice one Jamie. They do give a great sleigh ride, don't they.
Nice deal for sure there Jamie.  Gotta get the Bow goin!....
Nice carp!! That must have been loads of fun from a kayak. What was you setup, rod, reel, bait? Do you anchor the kayak? Anyways, great job.
Great catch Jamie! Looks like it must be fun catching them on the yak! Gotta try that someday
Nice fish Jamie. Why is it looking up at you in that pose?  Did you try tying a  harness to it and let it pull you around in that water. Trolling.
classic set up, baitrunner combo with my new secret corn receipe!
...pose? ....at least he isnt covering up the tail ..........
Nice fish. Another carp another happy angler.  I gota wonder what a 30+ would be like out of one of those cockle shells.
Beauty carp Jamie Well done and thanks for sharing Leechman
Love the Solopaddler pose!!! Great fish!  I've caught a carp and chinook in our canoe before...not as small as a kayak, but had both of them tow me around!!

Sometimes I don't know which one smells worse MJL's secret recipe or the carp itself. Victor's is pretty potent too. Whew!!!  I did find that the carp in Long Sault and Waddington NY didn't smell very much. I guess they didn't get much chance to eat those two guys secret bait.
Awesome job with the yak Jamie!  One thing I've always wanted to try was to hook a big carp from a float tube.
